text: Now the Reubenites and the Gadites possessed a very large number of cattle. When they saw that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were ideal for cattle,

the <st data-num="01121 01410">Gadites</st> and the <st data-num="01121 07205">Reubenites</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> and <st data-num="0559 0413">addressed</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>, and the <st data-num="05387" class="">leaders</st> of the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>. They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>,

“<st data-num="05852" class="">Ataroth</st>, <st data-num="01769" class="">Dibon</st>, <st data-num="03270" class="">Jazer</st>, <st data-num="05247" class="">Nimrah</st>, <st data-num="02809" class="">Heshbon</st>, <st data-num="0500" class="">Elealeh</st>, <st data-num="07643" class="">Sebam</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05015" class="">Nebo</st>, and <st data-num="01194" class="">Beon</st>,<n id="2" />
the land that the Lord subdued before the community of Israel, is ideal for cattle, and your servants have cattle.”
So they said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for our inheritance. Do not have us cross the Jordan River.”
Moses said to the Gadites and the Reubenites, “Must your brothers go to war while you remain here?
Why do you frustrate the intent of the Israelites to cross over into the land that the Lord has given them?

Your <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">did</st> <st data-num="03541" class="">the same thing</st> when I <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> them from <st data-num="06947" class="">Kadesh Barnea</st> to <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.
When they went up to the Eshcol Valley and saw the land, they frustrated the intent of the Israelites so that they did not enter the land that the Lord had given them.
So the anger of the Lord was kindled that day, and he swore,

‘<st data-num="03588" class="">Because</st> they have <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">followed</st> me <st data-num="04390" class="">wholeheartedly</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0518" class="">not</st><n id="2" /> one of the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> and <st data-num="04605" class="">upward</st><n id="3" /> who <st data-num="05927" class="">came</st> from <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> will <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> the <st data-num="0127" class="">land</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> I <st data-num="07650" class="">swore</st> to give<n id="4" /> to <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st>, <st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st>, and <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st>,
except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua son of Nun, for they followed the Lord wholeheartedly.’
So the Lord’s anger was kindled against the Israelites, and he made them wander in the wilderness for 40 years, until all that generation that had done wickedly before the Lord was finished.
Now look, you are standing in your fathers’ place, a brood of sinners, to increase still further the fierce wrath of the Lord against the Israelites.
For if you turn away from following him, he will once again abandon them in the wilderness, and you will be the reason for their destruction.”
Then they came very close to him and said, “We will build sheep folds here for our flocks and cities for our families,

but <st data-num="0587" class="">we</st> will <st data-num="02502" class="">maintain</st> ourselves <st data-num="02571" class="">in</st> <st data-num="02502" class="">armed</st> <st data-num="02571" class="">readiness</st><n id="1" /> and go <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="0834 0518">whenever</st> we have <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> them <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> their <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>. Our <st data-num="02945" class="">descendants</st> will be <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st> in <st data-num="04013" class="">fortified</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">towns</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">as a protection against</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="03427" class="">inhabitants</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.

We will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> our <st data-num="01004" class="">homes</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">every</st> <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelite</st> <st data-num="05157" class="">has</st> his <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st>.
For we will not accept any inheritance on the other side of the Jordan River and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this eastern side of the Jordan.”
Then Moses replied, “If you will do this thing, and if you will arm yourselves for battle before the Lord,
and if all your armed men cross the Jordan before the Lord until he drives out his enemies from his presence
and the land is subdued before the Lord, then afterward you may return and be free of your obligation to the Lord and to Israel. This land will then be your possession in the Lord’s sight.
“But if you do not do this, then look, you will have sinned against the Lord. And know that your sin will find you out.
So build cities for your descendants and pens for your sheep, but do what you have said you would do.”
So the Gadites and the Reubenites replied to Moses, “Your servants will do as our lord commands.

Our <st data-num="02945" class="">children</st>, our <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st>, our <st data-num="04735" class="">flocks</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> our <st data-num="0929" class="">livestock</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>,
but your servants will cross over, every man armed for war, to do battle in the Lord’s presence, just as our lord says.”
So Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua son of Nun, and to the heads of the families of the Israelite tribes.

Moses said to them: “If the Gadites and the Reubenites cross the Jordan with you, each one equipped for battle in the Lord’s presence, and you conquer the land, then you must allot them the territory of Gilead as their possession.

But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> they do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">cross over</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you <st data-num="02502" class="">armed</st>, they must <st data-num="0270" class="">receive possessions</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> you in <st data-num="0776 03667">Canaan</st>.”
Then the Gadites and the Reubenites answered, “Your servants will do what the Lord has spoken.
We will cross armed in the Lord’s presence into the land of Canaan, and then the possession of our inheritance that we inherit will be ours on this side of the Jordan River.”

So Moses gave to the Gadites, the Reubenites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph the realm of King Sihon of the Amorites, and the realm of King Og of Bashan, the entire land with its cities and the territory surrounding them.

The <st data-num="01121 01410">Gadites</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">rebuilt</st> <st data-num="01769" class="">Dibon</st>, <st data-num="05852" class="">Ataroth</st>, <st data-num="06177" class="">Aroer</st>,
<st data-num="05855" class="">Atroth Shophan</st>, <st data-num="03270" class="">Jazer</st>, <st data-num="03011" class="">Jogbehah</st>,

<st data-num="01039" class="">Beth Nimrah</st>, and <st data-num="01028" class="">Beth Haran</st> as <st data-num="04013" class="">fortified</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st>, and constructed <st data-num="01448" class="">pens</st> for their <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st>.

The <st data-num="01121 07205">Reubenites</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">rebuilt</st> <st data-num="02809" class="">Heshbon</st>, <st data-num="0500" class="">Elealeh</st>, <st data-num="07156" class="">Kiriathaim</st>,
Nebo, Baal Meon (with a change of name), and Sibmah. They renamed the cities they built.
The descendants of Machir son of Manasseh went to Gilead, took it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were in it.

So <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> to <st data-num="04353" class="">Machir</st>, <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>, and he <st data-num="03427" class="">lived</st> there.<n id="1" />

Now <st data-num="02971" class="">Jair</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> and <st data-num="03920" class="">captured</st> their <st data-num="02333" class="">small towns</st> and <st data-num="07121" class="">named</st> them <st data-num="02334" class="">Havvoth Jair</st>.<n id="1" />
Then Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages and called it Nobah after his own name.
